page.title: 05THEALE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Theale Primary School was established in 1833. The Rev. Thomas Shepherd who died in 1814 left "the annual sum of Â£20 forever for the establishment of a school at Theale in the parish of Tilehurst: to learn the poor children to read...and to instruct them their duty to God as taught by the Church, Catechism and excellent Liturgy". Records from 1833 to 1904 have been lost but log-books covering 1905 to 1985 are in the School's possession. Searches have shown that the school started with one classroom and over the years expanded to 9 classrooms and 230 pupils. The curriculum in 1985 is very different from that envisaged by Thomas Shepherd. Whilst reading is still the most important subject, children now use computers, undertake environmental studies and spend time on residential field-study trips.
